intro: Pyrus aromatica var. obovoidea, commonly known as the sweet cherry, is a cultivar of the common cherry tree. It is characterized by its oval-shaped, obovate leaves and small, sweet, edible fruits. The plant is a deciduous tree that typically grows to a height of 5–10 meters. It thrives in temperate climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. The flowers are white and fragrant, attracting pollinators such as bees.
